reference.shortdesc: The lcSingleSelect element was deprecated in DITA version 1.3. It was replaced with the lcSingleSelect2 element. It was originally intended to present three or more choices, only one of which is correct.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <!--Single select Interaction --> <lcSingleSelect id="singleselect"> <title>Multiple Choice - IEEE standards trivia</title> <lcQuestion>Which one of the listed standards committees is responsible for developing the token ring specification?</lcQuestion> <lcAnswerOptions> <lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerContent>IEEE 802.3</lcAnswerContent> <lcFeedback>Sorry. A little low.</lcFeedback> </lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerContent>IEEE 802.5</lcAnswerContent> <lcCorrectResponse/> <lcFeedback>That's the one.</lcFeedback> </lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerContent>IEEE 802.6</lcAnswerContent> <lcFeedback>Nope. Too high.</lcFeedback> </lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerOption> <lcAnswerContent>IEEE 802.11</lcAnswerContent> <lcFeedback>Nope. Way too high.</lcFeedback> </lcAnswerOption> </lcAnswerOptions> </lcSingleSelect>
